237            SRC, "main", "java", "com", "puppycrawl", "tools", "checkstyle").toString();

239    /** List of files who are superclasses and contain certain properties that checks inherit. */
240    private static final List<Path> MODULE_SUPER_CLASS_PATHS = List.of(
241        Path.of(MAIN_FOLDER_PATH, CHECKS, NAMING, "AbstractAccessControlNameCheck.java"),
242        Path.of(MAIN_FOLDER_PATH, CHECKS, NAMING, "AbstractNameCheck.java"),

246        Path.of(MAIN_FOLDER_PATH, CHECKS, "metrics", "AbstractClassCouplingCheck.java"),

250    /**
251     * Private utility constructor.
252     */
253    private SiteUtil() {
254    }
255
256    /**
257     * Get string values of the message keys from the given check class.
258     *
259     * @param module class to examine.
260     * @return a set of checkstyle's module message keys.
261     * @throws MacroExecutionException if extraction of message keys fails.
262     */
263    public static Set<String> getMessageKeys(Class<?> module)
264            throws MacroExecutionException {
265        final Set<Field> messageKeyFields = getCheckMessageKeys(module);
266        // We use a TreeSet to sort the message keys alphabetically
267        final Set<String> messageKeys = new TreeSet<>();
268        for (Field field : messageKeyFields) {
269            messageKeys.add(getFieldValue(field, module).toString());
270        }
271        return messageKeys;
272    }
273
274    /**
275     * Gets the check's messages keys.
276     *
277     * @param module class to examine.
278     * @return a set of checkstyle's module message fields.
279     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the attempt to read a protected class fails.
280     * @noinspection ChainOfInstanceofChecks
281     * @noinspectionreason ChainOfInstanceofChecks - We will deal with this at
282     *                     <a href="https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/13500">13500</a>
283     *
284     */
285    private static Set<Field> getCheckMessageKeys(Class<?> module)
286            throws MacroExecutionException {
287        try {
288            final Set<Field> checkstyleMessages = new HashSet<>();
289
290            // get all fields from current class
291            final Field[] fields = module.getDeclaredFields();
292
293            for (Field field : fields) {
294                if (field.getName().startsWith("MSG_")) {
295                    checkstyleMessages.add(field);
296                }
297            }
298
299            // deep scan class through hierarchy
300            final Class<?> superModule = module.getSuperclass();
301
302            if (superModule != null) {
303                checkstyleMessages.addAll(getCheckMessageKeys(superModule));
304            }
305
306            // special cases that require additional classes
307            if (module == RegexpMultilineCheck.class) {
308                checkstyleMessages.addAll(getCheckMessageKeys(Class
309                    .forName("com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.regexp.MultilineDetector")));
310            }
311            else if (module == RegexpSinglelineCheck.class
312                    || module == RegexpSinglelineJavaCheck.class) {
313                checkstyleMessages.addAll(getCheckMessageKeys(Class
314                    .forName("com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.regexp.SinglelineDetector")));
315            }
316
317            return checkstyleMessages;
318        }
319        catch (ClassNotFoundException exc) {
320            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT, "Couldn't find class: %s",
321                    module.getName());
322            throw new MacroExecutionException(message, exc);
323        }
324    }
325
326    /**
327     * Returns the value of the given field.
328     *
329     * @param field the field.
330     * @param instance the instance of the module.
331     * @return the value of the field.
332     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the value could not be retrieved.
333     */
334    public static Object getFieldValue(Field field, Object instance)
335            throws MacroExecutionException {
336        try {
337            // required for package/private classes
338            field.trySetAccessible();
339            return field.get(instance);
340        }
341        catch (IllegalAccessException exc) {
342            throw new MacroExecutionException("Couldn't get field value", exc);
343        }
344    }
345
346    /**
347     * Returns the instance of the module with the given name.
348     *
349     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
350     * @return the instance of the module.
351     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the module could not be created.
352     */
353    public static Object getModuleInstance(String moduleName) throws MacroExecutionException {
354        final ModuleFactory factory = getPackageObjectFactory();
355        try {
356            return factory.createModule(moduleName);
357        }
358        catch (CheckstyleException exc) {
359            throw new MacroExecutionException("Couldn't find class: " + moduleName, exc);
360        }
361    }
362
363    /**
364     * Returns the default PackageObjectFactory with the default package names.
365     *
366     * @return the default PackageObjectFactory.
367     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the PackageObjectFactory cannot be created.
368     */
369    private static PackageObjectFactory getPackageObjectFactory() throws MacroExecutionException {
370        try {
371            final ClassLoader cl = ViolationMessagesMacro.class.getClassLoader();
372            final Set<String> packageNames = PackageNamesLoader.getPackageNames(cl);
373            return new PackageObjectFactory(packageNames, cl);
374        }
375        catch (CheckstyleException exc) {
376            throw new MacroExecutionException("Couldn't load checkstyle modules", exc);
377        }
378    }
379
380    /**
381     * Construct a string with a leading newline character and followed by
382     * the given amount of spaces. We use this method only to match indentation in
383     * regular xdocs and have minimal diff when parsing the templates.
384     * This method exists until
385     * <a href="https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/13426">13426</a>
386     *
387     * @param amountOfSpaces the amount of spaces to add after the newline.
388     * @return the constructed string.
389     */
390    public static String getNewlineAndIndentSpaces(int amountOfSpaces) {
391        return System.lineSeparator() + WHITESPACE.repeat(amountOfSpaces);
392    }
393
394    /**
395     * Returns path to the template for the given module name or throws an exception if the
396     * template cannot be found.
397     *
398     * @param moduleName the module whose template we are looking for.
399     * @return path to the template.
400     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the template cannot be found.
401     */
402    public static Path getTemplatePath(String moduleName) throws MacroExecutionException {
403        final String fileNamePattern = ".*[\\\\/]"
404                + moduleName.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT) + "\\..*";
405        return getXdocsTemplatesFilePaths()
406            .stream()
407            .filter(path -> path.toString().matches(fileNamePattern))
408            .findFirst()
409            .orElse(null);
410    }
411
412    /**
413     * Gets xdocs template file paths. These are files ending with .xml.template.
414     * This method will be changed to gather .xml once
415     * <a href="https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/13426">#13426</a> is resolved.
416     *
417     * @return a set of xdocs template file paths.
418     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an I/O error occurs.
419     */
420    public static Set<Path> getXdocsTemplatesFilePaths() throws MacroExecutionException {
421        final Path directory = Path.of("src/site/xdoc");
422        try (Stream<Path> stream = Files.find(directory, Integer.MAX_VALUE,
423                (path, attr) -> {
424                    return attr.isRegularFile()
425                            && path.toString().endsWith(".xml.template");
426                })) {
427            return stream.collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableSet());
428        }
429        catch (IOException ioException) {
430            throw new MacroExecutionException("Failed to find xdocs templates", ioException);
431        }
432    }
433
434    /**
435     * Returns the parent module name for the given module class. Returns either
436     * "TreeWalker" or "Checker". Returns null if the module class is null.
437     *
438     * @param moduleClass the module class.
439     * @return the parent module name as a string.
440     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the parent module cannot be found.
441     */
442    public static String getParentModule(Class<?> moduleClass)
443                throws MacroExecutionException {
444        String parentModuleName = "";
445        Class<?> parentClass = moduleClass.getSuperclass();
446
447        while (parentClass != null) {
448            parentModuleName = CLASS_TO_PARENT_MODULE.get(parentClass);
449            if (parentModuleName != null) {
450                break;
451            }
452            parentClass = parentClass.getSuperclass();
453        }
454
455        // If parent class is not found, check interfaces
456        if (parentModuleName == null || parentModuleName.isEmpty()) {
457            final Class<?>[] interfaces = moduleClass.getInterfaces();
458            for (Class<?> interfaceClass : interfaces) {
459                parentModuleName = CLASS_TO_PARENT_MODULE.get(interfaceClass);
460                if (parentModuleName != null) {
461                    break;
462                }
463            }
464        }
465
466        if (parentModuleName == null || parentModuleName.isEmpty()) {
467            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT,
468                    "Failed to find parent module for %s", moduleClass.getSimpleName());
469            throw new MacroExecutionException(message);
470        }
471
472        return parentModuleName;
473    }
474
475    /**
476     * Get a set of properties for the given class that should be documented.
477     *
478     * @param clss the class to get the properties for.
479     * @param instance the instance of the module.
480     * @return a set of properties for the given class.
481     */
482    public static Set<String> getPropertiesForDocumentation(Class<?> clss, Object instance) {
483        final Set<String> properties =
484                getProperties(clss).stream()
485                    .filter(prop -> {
486                        return !isGlobalProperty(clss, prop) && !isUndocumentedProperty(clss, prop);
487                    })
488                    .collect(Collectors.toCollection(HashSet::new));
489        properties.addAll(getNonExplicitProperties(instance, clss));
490        return new TreeSet<>(properties);
491    }
492
493    /**
494     * Get the javadocs of the properties of the module. If the property is not present in the
495     * module, then the javadoc of the property from the superclass(es) is used.
496     *
497     * @param properties the properties of the module.
498     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
499     * @param modulePath the module file path.
500     * @return the javadocs of the properties of the module.
501     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during processing.
502     */
503    public static Map<String, DetailNode> getPropertiesJavadocs(Set<String> properties,
504                                                                String moduleName, Path modulePath)
505            throws MacroExecutionException {
506        // lazy initialization
507        if (SUPER_CLASS_PROPERTIES_JAVADOCS.isEmpty()) {
508            processSuperclasses();
509        }
510
511        processModule(moduleName, modulePath);
512
513        final Map<String, DetailNode> unmodifiableJavadocs =
514                ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.getJavadocsForModuleOrProperty();
515        final Map<String, DetailNode> javadocs = new LinkedHashMap<>(unmodifiableJavadocs);
516
517        properties.forEach(property -> {
518            final DetailNode superClassPropertyJavadoc =
519                    SUPER_CLASS_PROPERTIES_JAVADOCS.get(property);
520            if (superClassPropertyJavadoc != null) {
521                javadocs.putIfAbsent(property, superClassPropertyJavadoc);
522            }
523        });
524
525        assertAllPropertySetterJavadocsAreFound(properties, moduleName, javadocs);
526
527        return javadocs;
528    }
529
530    /**
531     * Assert that each property has a corresponding setter javadoc that is not null.
532     * 'tokens' and 'javadocTokens' are excluded from this check, because their
533     * description is different from the description of the setter.
534     *
535     * @param properties the properties of the module.
536     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
537     * @param javadocs the javadocs of the properties of the module.
538     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during processing.
539     */
540    private static void assertAllPropertySetterJavadocsAreFound(
541            Set<String> properties, String moduleName, Map<String, DetailNode> javadocs)
542            throws MacroExecutionException {
543        for (String property : properties) {
544            final boolean isDocumented = javadocs.containsKey(property)
545                   || SUPER_CLASS_PROPERTIES_JAVADOCS.containsKey(property)
546                   || TOKENS.equals(property) || JAVADOC_TOKENS.equals(property);
547            if (!isDocumented) {
548                throw new MacroExecutionException(String.format(Locale.ROOT,
549                   "%s: Missing documentation for property '%s'. Check superclasses.",
550                        moduleName, property));
551            }
552        }
553    }
554
555    /**
556     * Collect the properties setters javadocs of the superclasses.
557     *
558     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during processing.
559     */
560    private static void processSuperclasses() throws MacroExecutionException {
561        for (Path superclassPath : MODULE_SUPER_CLASS_PATHS) {
562            final Path fileNamePath = superclassPath.getFileName();
563            if (fileNamePath == null) {
564                throw new MacroExecutionException("Invalid superclass path: " + superclassPath);
565            }
566            final String superclassName = CommonUtil.getFileNameWithoutExtension(
567                fileNamePath.toString());
568            processModule(superclassName, superclassPath);
569            final Map<String, DetailNode> superclassJavadocs =
570                ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.getJavadocsForModuleOrProperty();
571            SUPER_CLASS_PROPERTIES_JAVADOCS.putAll(superclassJavadocs);
572        }
573    }
574
575    /**
576     * Scrape the Javadocs of the class and its properties setters with
577     * ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.
578     *
579     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
580     * @param modulePath the module Path.
581     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during processing.
582     */
583    private static void processModule(String moduleName, Path modulePath)
584            throws MacroExecutionException {
585        if (!Files.isRegularFile(modulePath)) {
586            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT,
587                    "File %s is not a file. Please check the 'modulePath' property.", modulePath);
588            throw new MacroExecutionException(message);
589        }
590        ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.initialize(moduleName);
591        final Checker checker = new Checker();
592        checker.setModuleClassLoader(Checker.class.getClassLoader());
593        final DefaultConfiguration scraperCheckConfig =
594                        new DefaultConfiguration(
595                                ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.class.getName());
596        final DefaultConfiguration defaultConfiguration =
597                new DefaultConfiguration("configuration");
598        final DefaultConfiguration treeWalkerConfig =
599                new DefaultConfiguration(TreeWalker.class.getName());
600        defaultConfiguration.addProperty(CHARSET, StandardCharsets.UTF_8.name());
601        defaultConfiguration.addChild(treeWalkerConfig);
602        treeWalkerConfig.addChild(scraperCheckConfig);
603        try {
604            checker.configure(defaultConfiguration);
605            final List<File> filesToProcess = List.of(modulePath.toFile());
606            checker.process(filesToProcess);
607            checker.destroy();
608        }
609        catch (CheckstyleException checkstyleException) {
610            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT, "Failed processing %s", moduleName);
611            throw new MacroExecutionException(message, checkstyleException);
612        }
613    }
614
615    /**
616     * Get a set of properties for the given class.
617     *
618     * @param clss the class to get the properties for.
619     * @return a set of properties for the given class.
620     */
621    public static Set<String> getProperties(Class<?> clss) {
622        final Set<String> result = new TreeSet<>();
623        final PropertyDescriptor[] propertyDescriptors = PropertyUtils.getPropertyDescriptors(clss);
624
625        for (PropertyDescriptor propertyDescriptor : propertyDescriptors) {
626            if (propertyDescriptor.getWriteMethod() != null) {
627                result.add(propertyDescriptor.getName());
628            }
629        }
630
631        return result;
632    }
633
634    /**
635     * Checks if the property is a global property. Global properties come from the base classes
636     * and are common to all checks. For example id, severity, tabWidth, etc.
637     *
638     * @param clss the class of the module.
639     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
640     * @return true if the property is a global property.
641     */
642    private static boolean isGlobalProperty(Class<?> clss, String propertyName) {
643        return AbstractCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)
644                    && CHECK_PROPERTIES.contains(propertyName)
645                || AbstractJavadocCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)
646                    && JAVADOC_CHECK_PROPERTIES.contains(propertyName)
647                || AbstractFileSetCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)
648                    && FILESET_PROPERTIES.contains(propertyName);
649    }
650
651    /**
652     * Checks if the property is supposed to be documented.
653     *
654     * @param clss the class of the module.
655     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
656     * @return true if the property is supposed to be documented.
657     */
658    private static boolean isUndocumentedProperty(Class<?> clss, String propertyName) {
659        return UNDOCUMENTED_PROPERTIES.contains(clss.getSimpleName() + DOT + propertyName);
660    }
661
662    /**
663     * Gets properties that are not explicitly captured but should be documented if
664     * certain conditions are met.
665     *
666     * @param instance the instance of the module.
667     * @param clss the class of the module.
668     * @return the non explicit properties.
669     */
670    private static Set<String> getNonExplicitProperties(
671            Object instance, Class<?> clss) {
672        final Set<String> result = new TreeSet<>();
673        if (AbstractCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)) {
674            final AbstractCheck check = (AbstractCheck) instance;
675
676            final int[] acceptableTokens = check.getAcceptableTokens();
677            Arrays.sort(acceptableTokens);
678            final int[] defaultTokens = check.getDefaultTokens();
679            Arrays.sort(defaultTokens);
680            final int[] requiredTokens = check.getRequiredTokens();
681            Arrays.sort(requiredTokens);
682
683            if (!Arrays.equals(acceptableTokens, defaultTokens)
684                    || !Arrays.equals(acceptableTokens, requiredTokens)) {
685                result.add(TOKENS);
686            }
687        }
688
689        if (AbstractJavadocCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)) {
690            final AbstractJavadocCheck check = (AbstractJavadocCheck) instance;
691            result.add("violateExecutionOnNonTightHtml");
692
693            final int[] acceptableJavadocTokens = check.getAcceptableJavadocTokens();
694            Arrays.sort(acceptableJavadocTokens);
695            final int[] defaultJavadocTokens = check.getDefaultJavadocTokens();
696            Arrays.sort(defaultJavadocTokens);
697            final int[] requiredJavadocTokens = check.getRequiredJavadocTokens();
698            Arrays.sort(requiredJavadocTokens);
699
700            if (!Arrays.equals(acceptableJavadocTokens, defaultJavadocTokens)
701                    || !Arrays.equals(acceptableJavadocTokens, requiredJavadocTokens)) {
702                result.add(JAVADOC_TOKENS);
703            }
704        }
705
706        if (AbstractFileSetCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)) {
707            result.add(FILE_EXTENSIONS);
708        }
709        return result;
710    }
711
712    /**
713     * Get the description of the property.
714     *
715     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
716     * @param javadoc the Javadoc of the property setter method.
717     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
718     * @return the description of the property.
719     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the description could not be extracted.
720     */
721    public static String getPropertyDescription(
722            String propertyName, DetailNode javadoc, String moduleName)
723            throws MacroExecutionException {
724        final String description;
725        if (TOKENS.equals(propertyName)) {
726            description = "tokens to check";
727        }
728        else if (JAVADOC_TOKENS.equals(propertyName)) {
729            description = "javadoc tokens to check";
730        }
731        else {
732            final String descriptionString = SETTER_PATTERN.matcher(
733                    DescriptionExtractor.getDescriptionFromJavadoc(javadoc, moduleName))
734                    .replaceFirst("");
735
736            final String firstLetterCapitalized = descriptionString.substring(0, 1)
737                    .toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT);
738            description = firstLetterCapitalized + descriptionString.substring(1);
739        }
740        return description;
741    }
742
743    /**
744     * Get the since version of the property.
745     *
746     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
747     * @param moduleJavadoc the Javadoc of the module.
748     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
749     * @param propertyJavadoc the Javadoc of the property setter method.
750     * @return the since version of the property.
751     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the module since version could not be extracted.
752     */
753    public static String getSinceVersion(String moduleName, DetailNode moduleJavadoc,
754                                         String propertyName, DetailNode propertyJavadoc)
755            throws MacroExecutionException {
756        final String sinceVersion;
757
758        final String hardCodedPropertyVersion = SINCE_VERSION_FOR_INHERITED_PROPERTY.get(
759            moduleName + DOT + propertyName);
760        final Optional<String> specifiedPropertyVersion =
761            getSpecifiedPropertyVersion(propertyName, moduleJavadoc);
762
763        if (hardCodedPropertyVersion != null) {
764            sinceVersion = hardCodedPropertyVersion;
765        }
766        else if (specifiedPropertyVersion.isPresent()) {
767            sinceVersion = specifiedPropertyVersion.get();
768        }
769        else {
770            final String moduleSince = getSinceVersionFromJavadoc(moduleJavadoc);
771
772            if (moduleSince == null) {
773                throw new MacroExecutionException(
774                        "Missing @since on module " + moduleName);
775            }
776
777            String propertySince = null;
778            if (propertyJavadoc != null) {
779                propertySince = getSinceVersionFromJavadoc(propertyJavadoc);
780            }
781
782            if (propertySince != null && isVersionAtLeast(propertySince, moduleSince)) {
783                sinceVersion = propertySince;
784            }
785            else {
786                sinceVersion = moduleSince;
787            }
788        }
789
790        return sinceVersion;
791    }
792
793    /**
794     * Gets the specifically indicated version of module's property from the javadoc of module.
795     *
796     * @param propertyName the name of property.
797     * @param moduleJavadoc the javadoc of module.
798     * @return the specific since version of module's property.
799     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the module since version could not be extracted.
800     */
801    private static Optional<String> getSpecifiedPropertyVersion(String propertyName,
802                                                      DetailNode moduleJavadoc)
803            throws MacroExecutionException {
804        Optional<String> specifiedVersion = Optional.empty();
805
806        final Optional<DetailNode> propertyModuleJavadoc =
807            getPropertyJavadocNodeInModule(propertyName, moduleJavadoc);
808
809        if (propertyModuleJavadoc.isPresent()) {
810            final DetailNode primaryJavadocInlineTag = JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(
811                propertyModuleJavadoc.get(), JavadocTokenTypes.JAVADOC_INLINE_TAG);
812
813            for (DetailNode textNode = JavadocUtil
814                .getNextSibling(primaryJavadocInlineTag, JavadocTokenTypes.TEXT);
815                 textNode != null && specifiedVersion.isEmpty();
816                 textNode = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(
817                     textNode, JavadocTokenTypes.TEXT)) {
818
819                final String textNodeText = textNode.getText();
820
821                if (textNodeText.startsWith(WHITESPACE + SINCE_VERSION)) {
822                    final int sinceVersionIndex = textNodeText.indexOf('.') - 1;
823
824                    if (sinceVersionIndex > 0) {
825                        specifiedVersion = Optional.of(textNodeText.substring(sinceVersionIndex));
826                    }
827                    else {
828                        throw new MacroExecutionException(textNodeText
829                            + " has no valid version, at least one '.' is expected.");
830                    }
831
832                }
833            }
834        }
835
836        return specifiedVersion;
837    }
838
839    /**
840     * Gets the javadoc node part of the property from the javadoc of the module.
841     *
842     * @param propertyName the name of property.
843     * @param moduleJavadoc the javadoc of module.
844     * @return the Optional of javadoc node part of the property.
845     */
846    private static Optional<DetailNode> getPropertyJavadocNodeInModule(String propertyName,
847                                                             DetailNode moduleJavadoc) {
848        Optional<DetailNode> propertyJavadocNode = Optional.empty();
849
850        for (DetailNode htmlElement = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(
851                JavadocUtil.getFirstChild(moduleJavadoc), JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_ELEMENT);
852            htmlElement != null && propertyJavadocNode.isEmpty();
853            htmlElement = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(
854                htmlElement, JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_ELEMENT)) {
855
856            final DetailNode htmlTag = JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(
857                htmlElement, JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_TAG);
858            final Optional<String> htmlTagName = Optional.ofNullable(htmlTag)
859                .map(JavadocUtil::getFirstChild)
860                .map(htmlStart -> {
861                    return JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(htmlStart, JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_TAG_NAME);
862                })
863                .map(DetailNode::getText);
864
865            if (htmlTag != null && "ul".equals(htmlTagName.orElse(null))) {
866
867                boolean foundProperty = false;
868
869                for (DetailNode innerHtmlElement = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(
870                        JavadocUtil.getFirstChild(htmlTag), JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_ELEMENT);
871                    innerHtmlElement != null && !foundProperty;
872                    innerHtmlElement = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(
873                        innerHtmlElement, JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_ELEMENT)) {
874
875                    final DetailNode liTag = JavadocUtil.getFirstChild(innerHtmlElement);
876
877                    if (liTag.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.LI) {
878
879                        final DetailNode primeJavadocInlineTag = JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(liTag,
880                            JavadocTokenTypes.JAVADOC_INLINE_TAG);
881
882                        if (primeJavadocInlineTag == null) {
883                            break;
884                        }
885
886                        final String examinedPropertyName = JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(
887                            primeJavadocInlineTag, JavadocTokenTypes.TEXT).getText();
888
889                        if (examinedPropertyName.equals(propertyName)) {
890                            propertyJavadocNode = Optional.ofNullable(liTag);
891                            foundProperty = true;
892                        }
893                    }
894                }
895            }
896        }
897
898        return propertyJavadocNode;
899    }
900
901    /**
902     * Extract the since version from the Javadoc.
903     *
904     * @param javadoc the Javadoc to extract the since version from.
905     * @return the since version of the setter.
906     */
907    @Nullable
908    private static String getSinceVersionFromJavadoc(DetailNode javadoc) {
909        final DetailNode sinceJavadocTag = getSinceJavadocTag(javadoc);
910        return Optional.ofNullable(sinceJavadocTag)
911            .map(tag -> JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(tag, JavadocTokenTypes.DESCRIPTION))
912            .map(description -> JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(description, JavadocTokenTypes.TEXT))
913            .map(DetailNode::getText)
914            .orElse(null);
915    }
916
917    /**
918     * Find the since Javadoc tag node in the given Javadoc.
919     *
920     * @param javadoc the Javadoc to search.
921     * @return the since Javadoc tag node or null if not found.
922     */
923    private static DetailNode getSinceJavadocTag(DetailNode javadoc) {
924        final DetailNode[] children = javadoc.getChildren();
925        DetailNode javadocTagWithSince = null;
926        for (final DetailNode child : children) {
927            if (child.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.JAVADOC_TAG) {
928                final DetailNode sinceNode = JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(
929                        child, JavadocTokenTypes.SINCE_LITERAL);
930                if (sinceNode != null) {
931                    javadocTagWithSince = child;
932                    break;
933                }
934            }
935        }
936        return javadocTagWithSince;
937    }
938
939    /**
940     * Returns {@code true} if {@code actualVersion}  {@code requiredVersion}.
941     * Both versions have any trailing "-SNAPSHOT" stripped before comparison.
942     *
943     * @param actualVersion   e.g. "8.3" or "8.3-SNAPSHOT"
944     * @param requiredVersion e.g. "8.3"
945     * @return {@code true} if actualVersion exists, and, numerically, is at least requiredVersion
946     */
947    private static boolean isVersionAtLeast(String actualVersion,
948                                            String requiredVersion) {
949        final Version actualVersionParsed = Version.parse(actualVersion);
950        final Version requiredVersionParsed = Version.parse(requiredVersion);
951
952        return actualVersionParsed.compareTo(requiredVersionParsed) >= 0;
953    }
954
955    /**
956     * Get the type of the property.
957     *
958     * @param field the field to get the type of.
959     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
960     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
961     * @param instance the instance of the module.
962     * @return the type of the property.
963     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during getting the type.
964     */
965    public static String getType(Field field, String propertyName,
966                                 String moduleName, Object instance)
967            throws MacroExecutionException {
968        final Class<?> fieldClass = getFieldClass(field, propertyName, moduleName, instance);
969        return Optional.ofNullable(field)
970                .map(nonNullField -> nonNullField.getAnnotation(XdocsPropertyType.class))
971                .map(propertyType -> propertyType.value().getDescription())
972                .orElseGet(fieldClass::getSimpleName);
973    }
974
975    /**
976     * Get the default value of the property.
977     *
978     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
979     * @param field the field to get the default value of.
980     * @param classInstance the instance of the class to get the default value of.
981     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
982     * @return the default value of the property.
983     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during getting the default value.
984     * @noinspection IfStatementWithTooManyBranches
985     * @noinspectionreason IfStatementWithTooManyBranches - complex nature of getting properties
986     *      from XML files requires giant if/else statement
987     */
988    // -@cs[CyclomaticComplexity] Splitting would not make the code more readable
989    public static String getDefaultValue(String propertyName, Field field,
990                                         Object classInstance, String moduleName)
991            throws MacroExecutionException {
992        final Object value = getFieldValue(field, classInstance);
993        final Class<?> fieldClass = getFieldClass(field, propertyName, moduleName, classInstance);
994        String result = null;
995        if (CHARSET.equals(propertyName)) {
996            result = "the charset property of the parent"
997                    + " <a href=\"https://checkstyle.org/config.html#Checker\">Checker</a> module";
998        }
999        else if (classInstance instanceof PropertyCacheFile) {
1000            result = "null (no cache file)";
1001        }
1002        else if (fieldClass == boolean.class) {
1003            result = value.toString();
1004        }
1005        else if (fieldClass == int.class) {
1006            result = value.toString();
1007        }
1008        else if (fieldClass == int[].class) {
1009            result = getIntArrayPropertyValue(value);
1010        }
1011        else if (fieldClass == double[].class) {
1012            result = removeSquareBrackets(Arrays.toString((double[]) value).replace(".0", ""));
1013            if (result.isEmpty()) {
1014                result = CURLY_BRACKETS;
1015            }
1016        }
1017        else if (fieldClass == String[].class) {
1018            result = getStringArrayPropertyValue(propertyName, value);
1019        }
1020        else if (fieldClass == URI.class || fieldClass == String.class) {
1021            if (value != null) {
1022                result = '"' + value.toString() + '"';
1023            }
1024        }
1025        else if (fieldClass == Pattern.class) {
1026            if (value != null) {
1027                result = '"' + value.toString().replace("\n", "\\n").replace("\t", "\\t")
1028                        .replace("\r", "\\r").replace("\f", "\\f") + '"';
1029            }
1030        }
1031        else if (fieldClass == Pattern[].class) {
1032            result = getPatternArrayPropertyValue(value);
1033        }
1034        else if (fieldClass.isEnum()) {
1035            if (value != null) {
1036                result = value.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ENGLISH);
1037            }
1038        }
1039        else if (fieldClass == AccessModifierOption[].class) {
1040            result = removeSquareBrackets(Arrays.toString((Object[]) value));
1041        }
1042        else {
1043            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT,
1044                    "Unknown property type: %s", fieldClass.getSimpleName());
1045            throw new MacroExecutionException(message);
1046        }
1047
1048        if (result == null) {
1049            result = "null";
1050        }
1051
1052        return result;
1053    }
1054
1055    /**
1056     * Gets the name of the bean property's default value for the Pattern array class.
1057     *
1058     * @param fieldValue The bean property's value
1059     * @return String form of property's default value
1060     */
1061    private static String getPatternArrayPropertyValue(Object fieldValue) {
1062        Object value = fieldValue;
1063        if (value instanceof Collection) {
1064            final Collection<?> collection = (Collection<?>) value;
1065
1066            value = collection.stream()
1067                    .map(Pattern.class::cast)
1068                    .toArray(Pattern[]::new);
1069        }
1070
1071        String result = "";
1072        if (value != null && Array.getLength(value) > 0) {
1073            result = removeSquareBrackets(
1074                    Arrays.stream((Pattern[]) value)
1075                    .map(Pattern::pattern)
1076                    .collect(Collectors.joining(COMMA_SPACE)));
1077        }
1078
1079        if (result.isEmpty()) {
1080            result = CURLY_BRACKETS;
1081        }
1082        return result;
1083    }
1084
1085    /**
1086     * Removes square brackets [ and ] from the given string.
1087     *
1088     * @param value the string to remove square brackets from.
1089     * @return the string without square brackets.
1090     */
1091    private static String removeSquareBrackets(String value) {
1092        return value
1093                .replace("[", "")
1094                .replace("]", "");
1095    }
1096
1097    /**
1098     * Gets the name of the bean property's default value for the string array class.
1099     *
1100     * @param propertyName The bean property's name
1101     * @param value The bean property's value
1102     * @return String form of property's default value
1103     */
1104    private static String getStringArrayPropertyValue(String propertyName, Object value) {
1105        String result;
1106        if (value == null) {
1107            result = "";
1108        }
1109        else {
1110            try (Stream<?> valuesStream = getValuesStream(value)) {
1111                result = valuesStream
1112                    .map(String.class::cast)
1113                    .sorted()
1114                    .collect(Collectors.joining(COMMA_SPACE));
1115            }
1116        }
1117
1118        if (result.isEmpty()) {
1119            if (FILE_EXTENSIONS.equals(propertyName)) {
1120                result = "all files";
1121            }
1122            else {
1123                result = CURLY_BRACKETS;
1124            }
1125        }
1126        return result;
1127    }
1128
1129    /**
1130     * Generates a stream of values from the given value.
1131     *
1132     * @param value the value to generate the stream from.
1133     * @return the stream of values.
1134     */
1135    private static Stream<?> getValuesStream(Object value) {
1136        final Stream<?> valuesStream;
1137        if (value instanceof Collection) {
1138            final Collection<?> collection = (Collection<?>) value;
1139            valuesStream = collection.stream();
1140        }
1141        else {
1142            final Object[] array = (Object[]) value;
1143            valuesStream = Arrays.stream(array);
1144        }
1145        return valuesStream;
1146    }
1147
1148    /**
1149     * Returns the name of the bean property's default value for the int array class.
1150     *
1151     * @param value The bean property's value.
1152     * @return String form of property's default value.
1153     */
1154    private static String getIntArrayPropertyValue(Object value) {
1155        try (IntStream stream = getIntStream(value)) {
1156            String result = stream
1157                    .mapToObj(TokenUtil::getTokenName)
1158                    .sorted()
1159                    .collect(Collectors.joining(COMMA_SPACE));
1160            if (result.isEmpty()) {
1161                result = CURLY_BRACKETS;
1162            }
1163            return result;
1164        }
1165    }
1166
1167    /**
1168     * Get the int stream from the given value.
1169     *
1170     * @param value the value to get the int stream from.
1171     * @return the int stream.
1172     */
1173    private static IntStream getIntStream(Object value) {
1174        final IntStream stream;
1175        if (value instanceof Collection) {
1176            final Collection<?> collection = (Collection<?>) value;
1177            stream = collection.stream()
1178                    .mapToInt(int.class::cast);
1179        }
1180        else if (value instanceof BitSet) {
1181            stream = ((BitSet) value).stream();
1182        }
1183        else {
1184            stream = Arrays.stream((int[]) value);
1185        }
1186        return stream;
1187    }
1188
1189    /**
1190     * Gets the class of the given field.
1191     *
1192     * @param field the field to get the class of.
1193     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
1194     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
1195     * @param instance the instance of the module.
1196     * @return the class of the field.
1197     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during getting the class.
1198     */
1199    // -@cs[CyclomaticComplexity] Splitting would not make the code more readable
1200    private static Class<?> getFieldClass(Field field, String propertyName,
1201                                          String moduleName, Object instance)
1202            throws MacroExecutionException {
1203        Class<?> result = null;
1204
1205        if (PROPERTIES_ALLOWED_GET_TYPES_FROM_METHOD
1206                .contains(moduleName + DOT + propertyName)) {
1207            result = getPropertyClass(propertyName, instance);
1208        }
1209        if (field != null && result == null) {
1210            result = field.getType();
1211        }
1212        if (result == null) {
1213            throw new MacroExecutionException(
1214                    "Could not find field " + propertyName + " in class " + moduleName);
1215        }
1216        if (field != null && (result == List.class || result == Set.class)) {
1217            final ParameterizedType type = (ParameterizedType) field.getGenericType();
1218            final Class<?> parameterClass = (Class<?>) type.getActualTypeArguments()[0];
1219
1220            if (parameterClass == Integer.class) {
1221                result = int[].class;
1222            }
1223            else if (parameterClass == String.class) {
1224                result = String[].class;
1225            }
1226            else if (parameterClass == Pattern.class) {
1227                result = Pattern[].class;
1228            }
1229            else {
1230                final String message = "Unknown parameterized type: "
1231                        + parameterClass.getSimpleName();
1232                throw new MacroExecutionException(message);
1233            }
1234        }
1235        else if (result == BitSet.class) {
1236            result = int[].class;
1237        }
1238
1239        return result;
1240    }
1241
1242    /**
1243     * Gets the class of the given java property.
1244     *
1245     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
1246     * @param instance the instance of the module.
1247     * @return the class of the java property.
1248     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during getting the class.
1249     */
1250    // -@cs[ForbidWildcardAsReturnType] Object is received as param, no prediction on type of field
1251    public static Class<?> getPropertyClass(String propertyName, Object instance)
1252            throws MacroExecutionException {
1253        final Class<?> result;
1254        try {
1255            final PropertyDescriptor descriptor = PropertyUtils.getPropertyDescriptor(instance,
1256                    propertyName);
1257            result = descriptor.getPropertyType();
1258        }
1259        catch (IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException exc) {
1260            throw new MacroExecutionException(exc.getMessage(), exc);
1261        }
1262        return result;
1263    }
1264
1265    /**
1266     * Get the difference between two lists of tokens.
1267     *
1268     * @param tokens the list of tokens to remove from.
1269     * @param subtractions the tokens to remove.
1270     * @return the difference between the two lists.
1271     */
1272    public static List<Integer> getDifference(int[] tokens, int... subtractions) {
1273        final Set<Integer> subtractionsSet = Arrays.stream(subtractions)
1274                .boxed()
1275                .collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableSet());
1276        return Arrays.stream(tokens)
1277                .boxed()
1278                .filter(token -> !subtractionsSet.contains(token))
1279                .collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableList());
1280    }
1281
1282    /**
1283     * Gets the field with the given name from the given class.
1284     *
1285     * @param fieldClass the class to get the field from.
1286     * @param propertyName the name of the field.
1287     * @return the field we are looking for.
1288     */
1289    public static Field getField(Class<?> fieldClass, String propertyName) {
1290        Field result = null;
1291        Class<?> currentClass = fieldClass;
1292
1293        while (!Object.class.equals(currentClass)) {
1294            try {
1295                result = currentClass.getDeclaredField(propertyName);
1296                result.trySetAccessible();
1297                break;
1298            }
1299            catch (NoSuchFieldException ignored) {
1300                currentClass = currentClass.getSuperclass();
1301            }
1302        }
1303
1304        return result;
1305    }
1306
1307    /**
1308     * Constructs string with relative link to the provided document.
1309     *
1310     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
1311     * @param document the path of the document.
1312     * @return relative link to the document.
1313     * @throws MacroExecutionException if link to the document cannot be constructed.
1314     */
1315    public static String getLinkToDocument(String moduleName, String document)
1316            throws MacroExecutionException {
1317        final Path templatePath = getTemplatePath(moduleName.replace("Check", ""));
1318        if (templatePath == null) {
1319            throw new MacroExecutionException(
1320                    String.format(Locale.ROOT,
1321                            "Could not find template for %s", moduleName));
1322        }
1323        final Path templatePathParent = templatePath.getParent();
1324        if (templatePathParent == null) {
1325            throw new MacroExecutionException("Failed to get parent path for " + templatePath);
1326        }
1327        return templatePathParent
1328                .relativize(Path.of(SRC, "site/xdoc", document))
1329                .toString()
1330                .replace(".xml", ".html")
1331                .replace('\\', '/');
1332    }
1333
1334    /** Utility class for extracting description from a method's Javadoc. */
1335    private static final class DescriptionExtractor {
1336
1337        /**
1338         * Extracts the description from the javadoc detail node. Performs a DFS traversal on the
1339         * detail node and extracts the text nodes.
1340         *
1341         * @param javadoc the Javadoc to extract the description from.
1342         * @param moduleName the name of the module.
1343         * @return the description of the setter.
1344         * @throws MacroExecutionException if the description could not be extracted.
1345         * @noinspection TooBroadScope
1346         * @noinspectionreason TooBroadScope - complex nature of method requires large scope
1347         */
1348        // -@cs[NPathComplexity] Splitting would not make the code more readable
1349        // -@cs[CyclomaticComplexity] Splitting would not make the code more readable.
1350        private static String getDescriptionFromJavadoc(DetailNode javadoc, String moduleName)
1351                throws MacroExecutionException {
1352            boolean isInCodeLiteral = false;
1353            boolean isInHtmlElement = false;
1354            boolean isInHrefAttribute = false;
1355            final StringBuilder description = new StringBuilder(128);
1356            final Deque<DetailNode> queue = new ArrayDeque<>();
1357            final List<DetailNode> descriptionNodes = getDescriptionNodes(javadoc);
1358            Lists.reverse(descriptionNodes).forEach(queue::push);
1359
1360            // Perform DFS traversal on description nodes
1361            while (!queue.isEmpty()) {
1362                final DetailNode node = queue.pop();
1363                Lists.reverse(Arrays.asList(node.getChildren())).forEach(queue::push);
1364
1365                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_TAG_NAME
1366                        && "href".equals(node.getText())) {
1367                    isInHrefAttribute = true;
1368                }
1369                if (isInHrefAttribute && node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.ATTR_VALUE) {
1370                    final String href = node.getText();
1371                    if (href.contains(CHECKSTYLE_ORG_URL)) {
1372                        handleInternalLink(description, moduleName, href);
1373                    }
1374                    else {
1375                        description.append(href);
1376                    }
1377
1378                    isInHrefAttribute = false;
1379                    continue;
1380                }
1381                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_ELEMENT) {
1382                    isInHtmlElement = true;
1383                }
1384                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.END
1385                        && node.getParent().getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_ELEMENT_END) {
1386                    description.append(node.getText());
1387                    isInHtmlElement = false;
1388                }
1389                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.TEXT
1390                        // If a node has children, its text is not part of the description
1391                        || isInHtmlElement && node.getChildren().length == 0
1392                            // Some HTML elements span multiple lines, so we avoid the asterisk
1393                            && node.getType() != JavadocTokenTypes.LEADING_ASTERISK) {
1394                    description.append(node.getText());
1395                }
1396                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.CODE_LITERAL) {
1397                    isInCodeLiteral = true;
1398                    description.append("<code>");
1399                }
1400                if (isInCodeLiteral
1401                        && node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.JAVADOC_INLINE_TAG_END) {
1402                    isInCodeLiteral = false;
1403                    description.append("</code>");
1404                }
1405            }
1406            return description.toString().trim();
1407        }
1408
1409        /**
1410         * Converts the href value to a relative link to the document and appends it to the
1411         * description.
1412         *
1413         * @param description the description to append the relative link to.
1414         * @param moduleName the name of the module.
1415         * @param value the href value.
1416         * @throws MacroExecutionException if the relative link could not be created.
1417         */
1418        private static void handleInternalLink(StringBuilder description,
1419                                               String moduleName, String value)
1420                throws MacroExecutionException {
1421            String href = value;
1422            href = href.replace(CHECKSTYLE_ORG_URL, "");
1423            // Remove first and last characters, they are always double quotes
1424            href = href.substring(1, href.length() - 1);
1425
1426            final String relativeHref = getLinkToDocument(moduleName, href);
1427            final char doubleQuote = '\"';
1428            description.append(doubleQuote).append(relativeHref).append(doubleQuote);
1429        }
1430
1431        /**
1432         * Extracts description nodes from javadoc.
1433         *
1434         * @param javadoc the Javadoc to extract the description from.
1435         * @return the description nodes of the setter.
1436         */
1437        private static List<DetailNode> getDescriptionNodes(DetailNode javadoc) {
1438            final DetailNode[] children = javadoc.getChildren();
1439            final List<DetailNode> descriptionNodes = new ArrayList<>();
1440            for (final DetailNode child : children) {
1441                if (isEndOfDescription(child)) {
1442                    break;
1443                }
1444                descriptionNodes.add(child);
1445            }
1446            return descriptionNodes;
1447        }
1448
1449        /**
1450         * Determines if the given child index is the end of the description. The end of the
1451         * description is defined as 4 consecutive nodes of type NEWLINE, LEADING_ASTERISK, NEWLINE,
1452         * LEADING_ASTERISK. This is an asterisk that is alone on a line. Just like the one below
1453         * this line.
1454         *
1455         * @param child the child to check.
1456         * @return true if the given child index is the end of the description.
1457         */
1458        private static boolean isEndOfDescription(DetailNode child) {
1459            final DetailNode nextSibling = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(child);
1460            final DetailNode secondNextSibling = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(nextSibling);
1461            final DetailNode thirdNextSibling = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(secondNextSibling);
1462
1463            return child.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.NEWLINE
1464                        && nextSibling.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.LEADING_ASTERISK
1465                        && secondNextSibling.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.NEWLINE
1466                        && thirdNextSibling.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.LEADING_ASTERISK;
1467        }
1468    }
1469}
